noun.name: traffic light
noun.discription: a device used to control the flow of traffic at intersections

object1.name: stop sign
object1.discription: in parallel with 'traffic light', is a sign used to indicate that vehicles must come to a complete stop

object2.name: speed limit sign
object2.discription: in parallel with 'traffic light', is a sign used to indicate the maximum speed allowed on a road

object3.name: yield sign
object3.discription: in parallel with 'traffic light', is a sign used to indicate that vehicles must yield the right-of-way to other traffic

object4.name: crosswalk
object4.discription: in parallel with 'traffic light', is a designated area for pedestrians to cross a road

object5.name: street lamp
object5.discription: in parallel with 'traffic light', is a lamp used to illuminate streets at night

object6.name: parking meter
object6.discription: in parallel with 'traffic light', is a device used to collect payment for parking in a designated area

object7.name: road barrier
object7.discription: in parallel with 'traffic light', is a barrier used to block or control the flow of traffic

object8.name: traffic cone
object8.discription: in parallel with 'traffic light', is a cone used to redirect or warn traffic
